instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2849: What is 820-2849? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Hi,

I got this board with a no backlight issue.
No liquid damage. It shows the question mark. Just no backlight.

I tried different monitor with different LVDS cable.
I changed the LVDS connector on the board.
I changed the LED Driver. I bought one from L2. I thought it was bad so I ordered few from China.

This is what I have:
<CHIP>U9700</CHIP>
Pin 1 VIN - 8.4V
Pin 3 SWA - 8.4V
Pin 4 SWB - 8.4V
Pin 6 EN - 8.4V
Pin 16 PWM - 3.3V I can see the nice square wave on the scope
Pin 22 OVP - 1.4V
Pin 24 VOUT - 8.4V

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> - 8.4V at the LVDS connector.
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> - 3.3V

This tells me the CHIP is bad, but that's impossible.  I ordered it from different location. 
I still have 3 to try, but I'm sure I'm missing something.

Thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Could be bad chip/soldering or a dead <DIODE>D9710</DIODE>. VDC1 and 2 ok?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Solved. C916 was cracked. There was no short, but pulled down the line. I thought ceramic caps are can't leak.
